intro: Pedicularis gracilis, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a role in the ecological balance of its environment. Pedicularis gracilis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique floral structure.
